items.sentence: This summer, I plan to read every book on these three shelves.
In junior high school, Tom was a better student than Mary was.
Tom is usually very shy, but today he doesn't seem shy at all.
Three of Tom Jackson's books have been translated into French.
Tom wrote a long letter to Mary, but he didn't send it to her.
I figure that there isn't any point in trying to persuade Tom.
Which do you play more often, your clarinet or your saxophone?
Tom plays the alto saxophone and Mary plays the bass clarinet.
I forgot to tell you when you're supposed to be here tomorrow.
Tom said that he wished he could've spent more time with Mary.
It isn't what Tom says that annoys me, but the way he says it.
Are you sure that it was Tom that you saw crossing the street?
The girl that Tom saw yesterday in the park is from Australia.
I suspect that Tom and Mary will have to do that on their own.
You're not really going to go to Boston in Tom's car, are you?
What'll become of the children now that both parents are dead?
I wouldn't get a cat if I were you. I'd suggest getting a dog.
Tom's mother doesn't think that anyone is good enough for Tom.
I took out the trash while you were gone. You should thank me.
The women surrounded me and started asking a lot of questions.
